Jennifer Marsh.Action: Approaches the office building confidently and carries a concealed firearm (9mm Glock) under her windbreaker, indicating preparedness and seriousness.
Stops primping in the elevator, showing awareness of superficiality and focusing on purpose rather than appearance.
Locks her gun in a drawer before working at her computer.
Teases Griffin good-naturedly, causing him to laugh.
Enthusiastically shows colleagues the progress of her investigation.
Politely and professionally calls a judge at home to request a search warrant, apologizing for the inconvenience and thanking him sincerely.
Quickly follows up on a lead from a colleague and coordinates with the U.S. Attorney’s office without hesitation.
Efficiently gathers information, swiftly completes a detailed search warrant application, coordinates with multiple contacts, and confidently convinces a judge to approve the warrant.
Calmly coordinates a raid by contacting FBI Tampa and organizing agents.
Smiles at Griffin’s banter about a confusing chatroom situation, showing friendly rapport.
Frowns and focuses intently on a disturbing website related to the case, showing professional seriousness but limited emotional openness.
Identifies and contacts FBI Tampa quickly and confidently to initiate an operation.
Notices the Post-it note and promptly investigates the website killwithme.com without hesitation.
Waits patiently as the killwithme.com site loads, showing focus and calm despite the initial emptiness of the page.
Studies the suffering kitten with a pained expression.
Answers the phone professionally and encourages cooperation with the field agents.
Notices the TV on the screen, uses mouse to screen-capture and magnify the image to get details.
Maintains focus on suffering kitten while processing critical evidence and communicating clearly on phone.
Acknowledges the recognition from Gray with a modest, slightly wistful reply about missing sweet dreams since leaving the Academy.
Smiles at the kitten on her screen, indicating a softer, more tender side.
Focuses intently on the disturbing content she's monitoring without showing emotional detachment but rather professional concern.
Writes down the message from the sinister site, showing careful attention but no emotional engagement beyond the professional.
Deduces the significance of a Swiss watch purchase on Father's Day, showing insightful pattern recognition.
Investigates live streaming content and correlates it precisely with a cable news broadcast, demonstrating technical skill and attention to detail.
Translates a cryptic message from a banner of text, indicating lateral thinking and problem-solving ability.
Disgusted by rubbernecking and leaves quickly
Playfully admonishes her mother for swearing, referencing their shared history
Pets the black cat sitting nearby
Smiles gently at her daughter, receives a hug, and peppers her with kisses
Cuts off the operator and confidently navigates to the crash site without hesitation.
Displays disgust at the rubberneckers and quickly decides to leave the crash site, showing emotional control and focus.
Locks away her Glock securely in a drawer, indicating responsible handling of a weapon.
Responds with gentle humor and affection towards her family, showing emotional intelligence but no clear competence indicator in a professional sense.
Does not elaborate or take further action regarding the crash or traffic, which might indicate a lack of proactivity beyond basic response.
Laughs and tickles Annie, making her giggle happily.
Scoops Annie up and carefully fastens her seatbelt, engaging in playful banter.
Smiles at her mother’s concerns, showing respect and affection.
Works hard mowing the lawn despite not noticing neighbor’s greeting.
Correctly assesses that the colors do not match when asked if they match.
Acknowledges her mother's advice about getting rest and chooses not to mow the lawn despite initial inclination.
Proceeds to mow the lawn diligently despite the noise and difficulty with the mower.
Engages warmly and playfully with Annie, demonstrating social skill and confidence in interpersonal interaction.
Pets and interacts gently with her cat, showing care and warmth before noticing it is stuck in glue.
Whispers 'Life’s A Bitch And Then You Die,' showing cynicism and possible emotional distancing.
Shakes her head at the futility of tracing IP addresses, expressing frustration but continuing her work.
Locks eyes with Brooks with a thorny subtext of mutual tension and lack of respect.
Attempts to run trace routing algorithms and analyze IP addresses on her computer.
Shakes her head at the futility of the computer trace results, showing frustration but recognition of difficulty.
Explains the situation clearly and shares detailed insights about the case to the team.
Exhibits a thorny subtext of disrespect towards Brooks and shows no interest in his attraction.
Identifies the improbability of the site's location being a coincidence and provides logical reasoning behind localizing the criminal.
Explains complex technical details about the site's sophisticated design and peer-to-peer video relaying clearly to others.
Firmly insists that obscenity is within their jurisdiction despite being talked down to by Brooks.
Attempts to have Griffin take a break and suggests working together as a team.
Suggests alerting STAD to identify new distributed serving technology and wants to reassign Griffin for better teamwork.
Insists firmly that the matter is within their jurisdiction despite dismissive remarks from Brooks.
Persists in pushing her point despite condescension and undermining from Brooks, showing confidence under pressure.
Flips open her laptop and starts typing despite being distracted and startled by a passing young man’s smile, showing engagement and focus.
Responds to Griffin’s self-deprecating comments with laughter and places a consoling arm around him.
Gives only a faint smile back to the young man on the street, indicating reserved friendliness but limited warmth.
Flips open laptop and starts typing immediately upon seeing something unexpected on screen, indicating readiness and attention.
Her face changes terribly upon seeing unexpected info, showing emotional reaction but no paralysis.
Strides quickly across parking lot to reach work, showing purposeful action and promptness.
Jokes with Griffin and consoles him, showing social skills but not directly related to competence in her work.
Urgently typing into keyboard about case details, demonstrating engagement and focus.
Points out the grim details of the torture website and explains the mechanics of how viewers accelerate the victim's suffering.
Smiles in a way that does not reassure Griffin after he comments about rubbing someone's nose in being right.
Points out and explains elements on the screen clearly and confidently (digital counter, number of viewers, text crawl).
Her smile does not reassure when Griffin comments she is rubbing his nose in being right.
Questions the relevance of a suspect’s priors, showing critical thinking and possibly skepticism of biases.
Expresses disbelief and concern when Brooks suggests a theory about a snuff film victim.
Shows empathy by noting the possibility that viewers hope the victim’s death isn’t real.
Questions the relevance of Miller's potential priors, showing critical thinking and focus on relevant information.
Analyzes the spike in viewer numbers and suggests it indicates control over the time of death, showing insight and understanding of the situation.
Reacts with disbelief to Brooks's speculation linking the snuff film to Miller, indicating skepticism and caution.
Smiles and shakes her head at Griffin’s odd mind, shows friendly tolerance.
Works efficiently and collaboratively with Griffin, sharing information and coordinating well.
Works in fast, efficient rhythm with Griffin, quickly identifying and burning down a major firewall using technical skills.
Acts confidently and knowledgeably about complicated encryption and network tracing tasks, contributing significantly to the investigation.
Relays information crisply and keeps pace with Griffin without hesitation, showing high capability and intelligence.
Exchanges polite greetings and shakes hands with Detective John Box, showing professional courtesy and slight friendly chemistry.
Sits back, visibly pissed when tricked with the egg rolls, showing frustration but no hostility toward Griffin.
Stares down Detective Box for a beat, indicating skepticism or assertiveness without outright rudeness.
Notices the mismatch with the egg rolls and immediately realizes the suspect routed them back to their own computer; reacts quickly to the alert of the intruder being purged.
Sits back, pissed, after realizing the suspect tricked them, showing momentary frustration but doesn't lose composure.
Receives random numbers as a text message and quickly attempts to react, indicating alertness.
Entering the conference room warily, showing caution and good situational awareness.
Engages politely and professionally with Detective John Box, showing social competence and confidence.
Stares down Brooks after he states no task force will be used yet, showing assertiveness but ambiguity in outcome.
Reluctantly obeys Brooks' order and sits resignedly after a tense exchange.
Cannot help but smile at Box’s thoroughness when describing Miller’s wife’s distress.
Sharply questions Brooks about schedule changes despite personal difficulties with her daughter.
Stares Brooks down to challenge his decision.
Challenges a superior's decision by calling it idiotic and questions changes to her schedule due to personal reasons.
Reluctantly obeys orders despite personal inconvenience, showing professionalism.
Engages thoughtfully in team discussion, asks pertinent questions about the case and the suspect's choices.
Smiles at Box's thorough work, recognizing and appreciating competence in others.
Speaks softly and thoughtfully about the severity of the situation, showing concern.
Watches Box leave attentively, showing engagement.
Notices Griffin's motionless state and checks on him, showing concern for a colleague.
Responds stoically to the death of Miller and the mass viewers mocking the victim, without showing outward anger or lashing out.
Analyzes and evaluates the Killwithme website, recognizing its unprecedented elusiveness and potential danger.
Translates online slang from the text banner quickly and accurately, showing understanding of the communication method used by the antagonist.
Remains calm and stoic after witnessing the horrific death and online reaction, indicating emotional control in a high-stress situation.
Packs up to leave without initiating further investigation or immediate action after the death, which might suggest a lack of urgency or initiative in that moment.
Answers the phone immediately despite being tired, showing responsiveness and alertness.
Pretends to nod off and joke with her family, showing ability to maintain composure and humor under stress.
Appears visibly shocked and alarmed after receiving the phone call, indicating an emotional reaction to critical news.
Engages professionally and thoughtfully in discussion with Box, acknowledges complexity of situation, responds calmly and reasonably.
Maintains composure in high-pressure environment, avoids sarcasm or hostility despite Box's blunt and crude language.

Engages in a quick, insightful exchange with Box, suggesting analytical thinking about the killer's motive and strategy.
Admits uncertainty when responding 'Maybe' to Box's question about the killer's motive, reflecting honesty and cautious reasoning rather than overconfident speculation.
Acknowledges a complicated theory about accomplices rather than fans, indicating nuanced understanding of the situation.
Admits she is a power user and engages in conversation on the tech angle, showing openness and collaboration.
Declines to join Box in the field due to preferring desk work, while anxiously watching him leave.
Admits she’s a Power User, showing technical knowledge.
Prefers desk work over field work, declining to join the team visiting a suspect's location.
Struggles to keep up with Box’s pace while descending steps.
Smiles at Griffin’s happy surprise when he visits unexpectedly.
Responds quickly and politely during task force introductions despite momentary distraction by personal email.
Swiftly walks down hall while checking messages on her Treo, showing multitasking and alertness.

Distracted by personal email during important meeting, causing delay in giving her introduction.
Confidently corrects the team about the suspect based on careful monitoring and evidence, demonstrating professional reliability and supportiveness.
Shows patience and understanding with her daughter’s dispute about who started teasing, emphasizing that it doesn’t matter who said it first.
Confidently disproves a suspect by citing specific, detailed information about his whereabouts and activities, demonstrating good recall and attention to detail.
Remains at her desk all day gathering and analyzing information, showing dedication and focus.
Takes time to reflect on a minor domestic conflict and quickly decides to follow up on an idea sparked by it, showing situational awareness and ability to connect seemingly unrelated details.
Jokes playfully with Griffin about crashing his date and splitting the check

Suggests slowing down their investigation pace, showing consideration

Works late into the night actively researching data and leads despite not finding immediate results.
Pulls Annie away from her work gently by the hand.

Sits next to sleeping Annie, smiles tenderly at the mess, clears it away, and pulls Annie’s blanket higher.

Pulls Annie’s blanket up higher and kisses her cheek tenderly, showing caring attentiveness.
Watches from the window, dead on her feet, indicating exhaustion and possibly ineffective rest or break.

Suggests going on vacation to Annie to brighten her mood.

Prioritizes work and safety over immediate family relaxation, showing responsibility but possibly hesitation or over-caution.
Refuses to leave her post and emotionally withstands watching her child leave, showing mental resilience and focus.

Unable to tolerate Griffin’s suffering, she impulsively leaves the room to escape the agony.

Adapts quickly by screen-capturing the crucial eye signals and enhancing them to aid in deciphering under pressure.
Screams and urgently commands to turn off the screen to stop the disturbing image.
Examines and deciphers the killer's cryptic message, showing concern for understanding the victim's state.

Orders agents to turn off the monitors immediately when the disturbing scene with Griffin and ants appears, demonstrating quick decisive action.
Exits the scene after interpreting the message without offering a clear plan for next steps or expressing confusion amidst a tense, chaotic situation.
Lets Box soothe and comfort her as she breaks down and weeps in his arms.
Initially picks up her weapon when knocked on the door but then sets it down and obeys Box's commands without resistance.

Sets down her weapon and opens door to intruder without protest, showing diminished alertness.
Displays brief defiance before obediently following Box’s orders to get in the shower, indicating some loss of agency.
Allows herself to be comforted and shows vulnerability, emotionally breaking down in Box’s arms.
Sits restored but faint after trauma, manages to eat dinner quietly, suggesting minimal capacity to care for herself currently.
Explains technical details patiently and clearly to Box, showing trust and cooperation.
Shares personal vulnerability about feeling targeted and having devices hacked, showing sincerity and openness.
Expresses desire to protect family by planning to disappear with them, showing caring and responsibility.
Looks away after eye contact and insists she will be fine to encourage Box to leave, showing a guarded but sincere concern for others.
Explains the use of spoof cards and their technical capabilities clearly and knowledgeably to Box.
Identifies that the attacker accessed her personal devices and those of her team, showing understanding of the security breach.
Demonstrates awareness of the danger and suggests removing herself from the case for safety, indicating realistic self-assessment.
Admits she is 'finished' and plans to disappear until the situation is resolved, implying a temporary withdrawal from active investigation.
Shows vulnerability by admitting she is bad at losing people and cries silently, receiving gentle comfort.
Carefully and quietly researches sensitive, tragic suicide videos alone in early morning, indicating reflective and serious engagement but no immediate interpersonal warmth shown.
Starts calmly to analyze and investigate potentially useful video files on a laptop after waking up, showing focus and problem-solving behavior.
Expresses emotional vulnerability openly, admitting she is bad at 'losing people,' showing self-awareness but possibly perceiving a personal limitation.
Allows Box to lean on her and adjusts the screen so he can see better, sharing a quiet moment of connection.
Engages in empathetic conversation about a tragic event with Box, showing sensitivity to the subject.

Pauses and freezes the picture when Box mentions the Burger King detail, showing careful attention to information.
Asks targeted questions about the professor and the college, indicating inquisitiveness and effort to gather details.
Smiles at Box during a phone call, showing a moment of warmth in a stressful day.
Addresses the Task Force with clarity and intensity, demonstrating professionalism but neutral emotional tone.

Addresses Task Force with clarity and intensity, controlling visuals and presenting complex information confidently.

Methodically presents layered information clearly and logically, displaying skill in gathering and synthesizing data important to the case.
Presents detailed, precise facts with clarity and calm after a traumatic event, showing control and informative communication.
Methodically uses multimedia (video clicks, freezing frames) to support her narrative, indicating thoughtful preparation and effective presentation skills.
Expresses anger toward the person who repeatedly exploited a tragedy for public consumption, advocates for arresting that person, and smiles encouragingly to her team.
Nods to proceed into dark, dangerous basement despite fear, showing courage and trust in partner.
Stops and vocalizes to the team that they have found the correct place, communicating clearly in a tense situation.

Shows visible signs of distress but remains professional, indicating sincerity and emotional authenticity.

Observes the empty computer area indicating the perpetrator anticipated her return.
Was off the case but still returned, showing commitment but possibly poor decision to disengage earlier.
Shows deep emotional response to victim's death and strong commitment to the case despite orders to take time off.
Rejects a passionate kiss gently, indicating consideration for others' feelings.
Refuses to relax or take a break as suggested, showing rigidity and possible impatience.
Carries her cat and brings a pet carrier into her vehicle, showing care for her pet.
Stops and checks noises in a motel room cautiously but without panic, showing calm and responsible behavior.
Reacting to unsettling radio editorial about morality and conscience with visible distress, indicating sensitivity and compassion.

Initially relaxes after finding nothing behind the shower curtain but remains tense and investigates further, showing persistence and thoroughness.
Catches her breath and snaps her holster shut after the cat jumps out, demonstrating controlled emotional response and composure.
Observes a surveillance camera and points it out, indicating awareness of her surroundings and situational understanding.
Gets unsettled by the radio editorial and changes stations, showing sensitivity but also a moment of distraction or emotional affect.
Comforts and soothes her frightened cat during a storm.
Reacts with fear and panic when her car fails in dangerous conditions.
Runs a red light and drives recklessly to escape or avoid something.
Yanks the wheel abruptly, runs red light, maneuvers aggressively on highway exit ramps and overpasses.
Struggles to manage sudden car failures (wipers stop, headlights go out, engine dies), wrestles with power steering, barely avoids a collision with a truck.
After stopping the car safely on the shoulder, quickly attempts to use her Treo to call for help despite 'service denied' message.
Expresses disgust and calls the exploitation of her father's suicide 'despicable.'
Breaks the passenger window to escape, showing determination and practical toughness but limited interpersonal warmth in this moment.
Despite being spooked and trapped, she quickly assesses her options, uses her gun to break the passenger window, and escapes the vehicle to seek help in the storm.
Initially tries multiple options to get help or escape (phone, door) before resorting to breaking the window, showing problem-solving under stress.
Does not immediately look out the passenger window when prompted by Owen over the speaker despite his explicit instruction.
Urgently calls FBI headquarters and requests quick connection to task force, showing concern for safety and procedural responsibility.
Shakes her head at the drunken frats' stupidity without aggression, showing tolerance.
Freezes and prepares weapon when threatened, prioritizing self-preservation over friendliness.

Remains alert and cautious when confronted with potential threat (frat boys) and reacts appropriately by reaching for her gun.
Jumps into her SUV quickly when sensing danger, showing readiness and survival instincts.
Startled and scared by her cat jumping on her, indicating momentary lapse in composure.
Frozen and slow to react as Owen emerges from the back seat to attack with a Taser, indicating possible hesitation or misjudgment in a dangerous situation.
Screams, struggles, and resists captivity with all her might despite extreme pain and danger.
Freezes when confronted by Owen unexpectedly and is quickly overpowered and restrained.
Screams, resists, kicks, and wriggles with all her might when being dragged and held captive.
Attempts to free herself despite injury and captivity, showing persistence and presence of mind.
Dazed and slow to understand some aspects of her imprisonment (e.g., the mechanism and her rising upside down).
Wrestles violently and tries to escape despite being restrained and in a dangerous situation.
Eyes bug out and shows horror when seeing the camera activate and the deadly device setup.
Attempts to send an emergency text to 911 despite being restrained and struggling.
Blindly hits keys on her Treo trying to be precise while chained and struggling.
Sends a concise text message '911...HOME...' indicating an attempt to alert authorities despite dire circumstances.
Fights violently to free herself and survive despite extreme danger.
Bangs into Owen to knock him away, resisting capture aggressively and risking injury to herself.
Displays agonized will and determination by shooting Owen despite incapacitation.
Bangs into Owen to knock him away, disrupting his attack attempt.
Manages to free her feet from the chains and get her hands in front, showing quick thinking and dexterity.
Ducks Owen's Taser shot, avoiding incapacitation.
Lunges for her Glock under severe duress despite being bound and partially incapacitated.
Shoots Owen in the chest while paralyzed and unable to pull the trigger fully by normal means, demonstrating extreme willpower and determination.
Spasms wildly and falls near danger (the blades), possibly showing loss of control in a critical moment.
